page.title: 06WELD ESTATES
page.content: Mr.Rothwell,the land agent,for the Weld Estates came to school to tell us about the land South of the A352 road that is owned by the Weld Family.Mr. Rothwell brought his 'Terriers'with him.These are not dogs but big,thick books that contain lists of all the lands that are owned by the Weld Estates.The word'Terrier' comes from the Latin word 'Terra' meaning land. They have 121.37 acres of woodland.In 1957 Coombe Wood and North Wood were leased to the Forestry Commission for 200 years.They grow Larch and Douglas Fir.When the trees are mature and cut they will probably go for paper pulp. The trees have to be protected;by wire netting;from rabbits and hares.If the trees are nibbled when they are small they grow two leaders or trunks which means they are not so strong or useful.
